of Descartes instance to get result"},"return":"bool, indicates the result is readybool, indicates the sdk is still runningaddress, the user to blame for the abnormal stop of the sdkbytes32, the result of the sdk if available"},"instantiate(uint256,bytes32,uint64,uint64,uint256,address,address,(uint64,uint64,bytes,bytes32,address,bool,bool)[])":{"params":{"_finalTime":"max cycle of the machine for that computation","_inputDrives":"an array of drive which assemble the machine","_outputPosition":"position of the output drive","_roundDuration":"duration of the round (security param)","_templateHash":"hash of the machine with all drives empty"},"return":"uint256, Descartes index"},"provideDirectDrive(uint256,bytes)":{"params":{"_index":"index of Descartes instance the drive belongs to.","_value":"bytes value of the direct drive"}},"provideLoggerDrive(uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"_index":"index of Descartes instance the drive belongs to","_root":"root hash of the logger drive"}},"revealLoggerDrive(uint256)":{"params":{"_index":"index of Descartes instance the drive belongs to"}},"submitClaim(uint256,bytes32,bytes32[][],bytes,bytes32[])":{"details":"Example: consider 3 drives, the first drive's siblings should be a pristine machine.      The second drive's siblings should be the machine with drive 1 mounted.      The third drive's siblings should be the machine with drive 2 mounted.","params":{"_claimedFinalHash":"is the final hash of the machine","_drivesSiblings":"is an array of siblings of each drive (see below example)","_output":"is the bytes32 value of the output position","_outputSiblings":"is the siblings of the output drive"}},"winByVG(uint256)":{"params":{"_index":"index of Descartes instance to win"}}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"abortByDeadline(uint256)":{"notice":"Abort the instance by missing deadline."},"challenge(uint256)":{"notice":"Challenger disputes the claim, starting a verification game."},"confirm(uint256)":{"notice":"Challenger accepts claim."},"destruct(uint256)":{"notice":"Deactivate a Descartes SDK instance."},"getResult(uint256)":{"notice":"Get result of a finished instance."},"getState(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Get state of the instance concerning given user."},"getSubInstances(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Get sub-instances of the instance."},"instantiate(uint256,bytes32,uint64,uint64,uint256,address,address,(uint64,uint64,bytes,bytes32,address,bool,bool)[])":{"notice":"Instantiate a Descartes SDK instance."},"isConcerned(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Is the given user concern about this instance."},"provideDirectDrive(uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Provide the content of a direct drive (only drive provider can call it)."},"provideLoggerDrive(uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Provide the root hash of a logger drive (only drive provider can call it)."},"revealLoggerDrive(uint256)":{"notice":"Reveal the content of a logger drive (only drive provider can call it)."},"submitClaim(uint256,bytes32,bytes32[][],bytes,bytes32[])":{"notice":"Claimer claims the machine final hash and also validate the drives and initial hash of the machine."},"winByVG(uint256)":{"notice":"In case one of the parties wins the verification game,         then he or she can call this function to claim victory in         this contract as nodes.documentation: @notice several require statements for a drive
nodes.name: requirementsForProviderDrive

params._index: index of Descartes instance to abort
index of Descartes instance which challenger is starting the VG.
index of Descartes instance that the challenger is confirming the claim.
index of Descartes instance to deactivate
index of Descartes instance to get result

getResult(uint256).return: bool, indicates the result is readybool, indicates the sdk is still runningaddress, the user to blame for the abnormal stop of the sdkbytes32, the result of the sdk if available

params._finalTime: max cycle of the machine for that computation
params._inputDrives: an array of drive which assemble the machine
params._templateHash: hash of the machine with all drives empty

params._index: index of Descartes instance the drive belongs to.
params._value: bytes value of the direct drive

params._index: index of Descartes instance the drive belongs to
params._root: root hash of the logger drive

params._index: index of Descartes instance the drive belongs to

submitClaim(uint256,bytes32,bytes32[][],.details: Example: consider 3 drives, the first drive's siblings should be a pristine machine.      The second drive's siblings should be the machine with drive 1 mounted.      The third drive's siblings should be the machine with drive 2 mounted.

params._claimedFinalHash: is the final hash of the machine
params._drivesSiblings: is an array of siblings of each drive (see below example)
params._output: is the bytes32 value of the output position
params._outputSiblings: is the siblings of the output drive

params._index: index of Descartes instance to win

abortByDeadline(uint256).notice: Abort the instance by missing deadline.

challenge(uint256).notice: Challenger disputes the claim, starting a verification game.

getResult(uint256).notice: Get result of a finished instance.

getState(uint256,address).notice: Get state of the instance concerning given user.

isConcerned(uint256,address).notice: Is the given user concern about this instance.

provideDirectDrive(uint256,bytes).notice: Provide the content of a direct drive (only drive provider can call it).

provideLoggerDrive(uint256,bytes32).notice: Provide the root hash of a logger drive (only drive provider can call it).

revealLoggerDrive(uint256).notice: Reveal the content of a logger drive (only drive provider can call it).

submitClaim(uint256,bytes32,bytes32[][],.notice: Claimer claims the machine final hash and also validate the drives and initial hash of the machine.

winByVG(uint256).notice: In case one of the parties wins the verification game,         then he or she can call this function to claim victory in         this contract as well.
